Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:
•	Process Safety Information
•	Process Hazard Analysis
•	Operating Procedures

4. Five-Year Accident History

For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of §68.42(a), the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section §68.42(b) on each accident covered by section §68.42(a).

The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Lineage- Agua Mansa has had no releases in the last five years that meet the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 

5. Emergency Response Program

In addition, Lineage-Agua Mansa has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, provide first aid and medical treatment, and contact federal, state, and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the local fire department or HAZMAT Team. 

6.Planned Changes To Improve Safety

Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:
•	A Hazard Assessment, which was performed on August 28, 2023.
•	A Process Hazard Analysis, which was performed on November 15, 2023.
•	A Compliance audit, which was performed on February 2, 2023.

Executive Summary Components:

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source 

Lineage has a long-standing commitment to the worker, public, and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is Lineage's policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  

The Program 3 at Lineage- Agua Mansa, is a facility-run program with continuous support from the Lineage- Compliance Department that includes Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance. 
  
2. Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled

Lineage- Agua Mansa is located at 2063 W. Miguel Bustamante Parkway in Colton, California. The facility is situated approximately 1.9 miles northwest of Highway 215 and 2 miles south of Interstate 10. 

The area immediately surrounding the facility is rural with a mixture of light industrial and residential areas.  
The facility was constructed and began operations in 2014.
  
The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All of the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.

3. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

As part of the implementation of the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage- Agua Mansa, which also serve to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  

The regulated substance is over 10,000 lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and OSHA PSM.   As a resul
